oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Josh Kear - 2018-02-03
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by singer songwriter Josh Kear from the Ford theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on February 3, 2018. Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Josh Kear;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening comments and introductions by ?? begin in progress / (02:47) Opening comments by Josh / (03:24) Josh talks about writing drinking songs and writing the next song with Dierks Bentley / (05:23) Performs Drunk On A Plane / (10:18) Introduces the next song / (11:58) Performs an unidentified song likely titled Songs / (14:34) Performs Before He Cheats / (17:33) Tells story about the first time Carrie Underwood heard the song Before He Cheats / (18:54) Performs unrecorded last verse of the song Before He Cheats / (19:47) Talks about the next song / (21:20) Performs Most People Are Good / (24:52) Answers question about who he writes his songs for talks about his early days in town songwriting / (28:29) Answers question about how many songs that he writes get recorded and become a hits and does he know that when he writes them / (30:58) Answers question about his thoughts about attending college helping him in the music business /

(33:01) Answers question about writing lyrics or music first and writing with other co-writers / (35:29) Answers question about where he writes most of his songs / (37:08) Answers question about who he would be if he could be anybody else / (38:20) Talks about the Bluebird Cafe / (39:10) Answers question about the song writing process / (41:45) Introduces the next song / (42:34) Performs Need You Know / (46:17) Final comments from Josh / (46:26) Walk-out Music / (47:25) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Kear, Josh; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
